page.title: 05The Bell,Waltham St Lawrence
page.content:
{The Bell Inn}is situated in the middle of the village. It is a very old building dating back to the fourteenth century. It is a popular tourist attraction in the village
The pub is made of plaster and brick with an {oak frame}. There is a large garden at the back with a nice gravel drive. As well as selling drinks you can also buy food at the pub if you want to.
The Bell is especially interesting as it is administered by a{parish {trust}. The inhabitants of the parish and their heirs were made trustees in 1608 with all rents and benefits going to the poor and needy people of the parish. This means that the landlord of the Inn is a tenant.
